title: It's like the Riot dev team has never actually played against Yasuo or Fiora.
body:
In response to this posting from the Dev Blog: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses

Skirmishers

Unlike Assassins, Skirmishers aim to shred through any nearby enemy that approaches. Because _**Skirmishers lack high-end burst damage or reliable ways of closing in on high-priority targets**_, they are instead armed with situationally powerful defensive tools to survive in the fray, along with extreme sustained damage to cut down even the most durable targets.

Really?

replies.body: My personal opinion is Yasuo has never been very happy about hitting anyone but high priority targets.  But he definitely gets punished when he overextends, and he frequently needs assistance in getting to the back line (an ally to knock them up). Fiora, on the other hand, I've seen chew through a lot of tanks in her time.  Her ultimate payoff makes a lot of sense in pushing that forward: she rewards her team substantially by killing a tank before picking other targets.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Kf5sGEcv,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-18T23:01:22.540+0000)
>
> My personal opinion is Yasuo has never been very happy about hitting anyone but high priority targets.  But he definitely gets punished when he overextends, and he frequently needs assistance in getting to the back line (an ally to knock them up). Fiora, on the other hand, I've seen chew through a lot of tanks in her time.  Her ultimate payoff makes a lot of sense in pushing that forward: she rewards her team substantially by killing a tank before picking other targets.

Yasuo's problem is that he is balanced around his own knockup (his Q), and is completely utterly broken when he has an ally Malphite or Alistar in the game.

I think "completely and utterly broken" is some pretty extreme hyperbole.

I wouldn't say Yasuo's ult is "balanced around" there being knockups on his team. The more knockups a team can have, the more beneficial it is for the Yasuo, sure. But to that, I would say that crafting team compositions around carries is nothing new in League.

Would you say Kog'maw is equally broken if he has a Lulu support and a Karma mid to protect him? Or that Jarvan's ult is broken if the enemy team has no mobility? Do you feel equally as strong about game 5 of the NA LCS Finals between CLG and TSM yesterday?

I'll agree that, in this case, it is a little awkward in so far that he can gain _so much_ if his teammates play around him. No other champion, to my knowledge, has quite so much variability that is based on his teammates' choices. A lot can go well for Yas if his team cooperates...but then again, if they don't, then the only knockup he has available to him is his Q, which is slow and _extremely_ telegraphed. This is on top of him being one of the highest skill floor champions in the game, as well. A lot of things have to go well for Yasuo to succeed. So if he manages to pull it off, he should be rewarded, no?

Also, let's at least be thorough. According to [the wiki](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Category:Knockup_champion), there are 27 champs, Yasuo included, that have knockups.

If a malphite ults, and the yasuo waits until the very last millisecond to press R, you can be suspended in the air for a LONG time.

It's really really broken.

So broken that I actually dodge every time Yasuo/malph is picked. Even if it means a 30 minute timer and -10 LP twice in a row.

Yasuo doesn't care who he hits. Double crit is double damage which is double lifesteal too. He doesn't care if he e's through a minion a tank or a jungle monster as long as it gets him where he wants to be. He doesn't care what he hits with q as long as it charges his knockup. And he doesn't care who he ults because he gets the bonus armor pen on everyone regardless of who was hit and he gets a shield refresh too. And who needs to time a windwall its pretty lenient given its duration and size(later on of course) and unlike braum it blocks the moves in its entirety. At least braum gets hurt when he blocks things.

I know hes not popular and not doing the best now but hes not exactly a joy to play against unless you're a brusier/tank because your tanky enough to withstand a crit and don't rely on projectiles for him to block.

Fiora was just broken and its a shame it took riot so long to fix her even when she was a competitive pick/ban for some time.

Because he doesn't has a line skillshot knockup of his own that affects EVERYONE it hits amirite? the way you lay this down make it sound like his Q should knockup only the first person it hits, that would be a good direction in order to put him in line with the description but even then, double crit...

As far as Fiora, true damage... seriously, no burst?

I think the problem lies in the fact that the description is pretty accurate in team fights and wildly off in 1v1s and a variety of fights involving usually 4 or less people in total.

In the mid game try stopping a Yasuo who's split pushing top and has a record like 3/2/2 by bringing just two players and you might get rolled hard by that Yasuo in just a couple seconds. Also both Yasuo and Fiora can in fact burst squishies pretty well, especially if ahead. Shiv procs and Fiora passive procs are nothing to laugh at.
I...don't think that's what the OP was complaining about.

Compare Yasuo and Fiora's ability to dive past your frontline, burst down a squishy in 1-2 seconds and get back out to an equally fed Fizz or Zed.

Hint: it's not the same.

Yasuo/Fiora doesn't immediately jump on your high priority teammate unless your team lets them or your team is just that poorly out of position, and when they do they aren't taking them out anywhere near as fast as an assassin is.

"Really?" is not an argument. Hell, it's hardly even a response.

I can assume based on your emphasis in the quote, but I don't see anything _wrong_ with what you emphasized, so I'm at a loss.

Are you saying that Yasuo has reliable ways of closing in on high-priority targets? And are you saying that Fiora has high-end burst damage and reliable ways of closing in on high-priority targets?

Because if you are, you're wrong.

Yasuo can have some burst if he's able to ult onto somebody. Nobody is arguing differently. Maybe you skipped over, like...the whole post, where they repeatedly say that classes/subclasses are not rigid and are more like guidelines than rules.

Just because Garen has a movement speed buff doesn't mean he's not a Juggernaut.

Just because Fizz can build Sunfire/IBG doesn't mean he's not an Assassin.

Lux is not an Enchanter just because she can shield allies.

Etc.

I think it's pretty accurate. It does say they have extreme sustained damage. Think of it as the difference between Lux and Azir. A lategame Azir might still burst you down, especially if he slides on you, but overall his pattern is just very high sustained damage. vs lux who catches you and instagibs you. In this case, the difference between fiora/yi/yasuo's damage and assasins like kha'zix is pretty big, even if the damage is very high from fiora
They still play like assassins, you get in some ones face, and they die, or you die.
Yasuo and Fiora are melee carries.
